title: How a chair conquered the world
resume:
Pull up a chair. And take a good look at it.
It forms our bodies. It shapes our
thinking. It’s one of the first technologies
an American or European child encounters.
author: Edward Tenner

title: A Day in the Life of a Chair
resume: What does a day in the life of a chair look like? Well, that depends on the day. There’s no such thing as a ‘normal’ day for me, no nine-to-five—I have to roll with the punches...
author: Max Küng

title: White Plastic Chairs Are Taking Over the World
resume: There are billions of monobloc chairs around the world, and they are completely context free—you can't tell when or where you are by looking at them. We asked a leading scholar if we should be worried by that
author: Jules Suzdaltsev

title: [POP CULTURE]
resume: As everyday objects, it's easy for our readers to have many anecdotes to share, so we asked them to send us letters about their favorite chairs and why they bring them joy.
author: Lourdes Marco

title: [SHORT STORIES]
resume: <div class=resumen>A lot of memorable chairs that you may recognize because they have made their mark in pop culture and society.
author: Lourdes Marco
